title: Mick Heaton
text: James Michael Heaton (15 January 1947 – 11 April 1995) was an English former <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="full-back%20%28association%20football%29">full-back</a>. He played in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> for <a href="Blackburn%20Rovers%20F.C.">Blackburn Rovers</a> and captained them to the 1975 Third Division Championship. He later coached Blackburn and <a href="Everton%20F.C.">Everton</a> alongside <a href="Howard%20Kendall">Howard Kendall</a>, and was an integral, yet underrated part of the Everton management team that won two league titles, an FA Cup, and a European Cup Winner’s Cup. Heaton died in a car accident in 1995
